subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-Lysosomal Membrane Damage and Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage, mtDNA damage, and a vicious cycle accelerating aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as a driver of aging, oxidative damage accumulation, and lifespan modulation by antioxidants.
Highlights age-related increase in mitochondrial superoxide production and oxidative stress as causal in aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative mtDNA damage and systemic aging via a vicious cycle.
Focuses on complex I ROS generation as a key determinant of longevity and aging via mitochondrial oxidative damage.
Details mitochondrial ROS metabolism and damage accumulation as fundamental causes of aging.
Links electron transport chain dysfunction to increased ROS, oxidative stress, apoptosis, and aging phenotypes.
Includes mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS generation, and mtDNA mutation accumulation impacting aging and longevity.
Describes ROS accumulation, mtDNA mutations, and oxidative damage as central to mitochondrial aging.
Proposes oxidative phosphorylation decline due to free radical mtDNA damage affecting oocyte quality and aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial oxidative damage and ROS accumulation impairing male reproductive aging.
Revisits mitochondrial oxidant theory with mitohormesis and hyperfunction, emphasizing ROS signaling in aging.
Focuses on somatic mtDNA mutation accumulation from replication errors causing respiratory chain dysfunction and aging.
Emphasizes accumulation of mtDNA deletions causing mitochondrial dysfunction and cellular senescence.
Describes progressive mtDNA mutation accumulation causing bioenergetic decline and tissue aging mosaics.
Links species-specific mtDNA replication modes to deletion formation and lifespan via mtDNA mutation accumulation.
Focuses on inherited mtDNA variability and haplogroups influencing mitochondrial function, aging, and longevity.
Describes loss of redundancy due to oxidative damage to mitochondrial biomolecules including mtDNA, impairing function.
Focuses on decline in mitochondrial energy metabolism (ATP/ADP ratio) as a fundamental aging mechanism.
Emphasizes mitochondrial metabolic functions beyond ROS, including TCA cycle, Fe/S cluster biosynthesis, and mitophagy.
Focuses on age-related decline in electron transport chain (CcO) activity reducing bioenergetic reserve and lifespan.
Proposes free radical-induced mitochondrial membrane damage and water loss impair metabolism and energy availability.
Describes mitonuclear imbalance and mitochondrial unfolded protein response (UPRmt) as key in mitochondrial aging and metabolism.
Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction thresholds and compensatory stress responses influencing aging outcomes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-Lysosomal Membrane Damage and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondrial and lysosomal membrane damage disrupts autophagy, causing accumulation of damaged mitochondria and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-Lysosomal Membrane Damage and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of lipofuscin and defective mitochondria due to lysosomal dysfunction, creating a damaging feedback loop.
Focuses on mitochondrial enzyme CLK-1/MCLK1 in ubiquinone biosynthesis and its modulation slowing aging and neurodegeneration.
